stories.text:
The worst part of my day is when I put on my glasses. I hate wearing glasses. They're never clean, I can always see dust and lens flares which means all my software has to be in nightmode. I can feel them on my ears all the time, it doesn't matter how good my glasses are I'm just constantly aware of my ears. I hate breaking them in, I've been wearing the same glasses for 5 years. And contacts are not a good solution for me, (this is literally just me) the first time I fail to get one in my mind is filled with every frustrating event thats ever happened to me and I can't continue.

The correct solution for me is to get my eyes lasered, but thats expensive, dangerous, and involves a recovery period.

I don't mind wearing my glasses all day. I just wanted to ask if someone knew a better way?
stories.title: Ask HN: How can I see my screens without needing glasses
Google Maps suspends live traffic layer in Ukraine

stories.text:
I'm looking to build a raspberry pi smart mirror.

On Amazon and AliExpress, there are a bunch of Android-based smart mirrors with pre-built operating systems.

On the other hand, there are a lot of DIY guides where you build the mirror from scratch, including cutting wood and attaching the mirror.

What I'd like is just the smart mirror, pre-built, but as a display only. I want to attach the HDMI cable and control the display using a raspberry pi.

Is there anywhere I can just buy the smart mirror, without operating system, and without having to build it myself?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is there a smart mirror with HDMI input?
